forecast-period.text: For latest warnings go to www.bom.gov.au, subscribe to RSS feeds, call 1300-659-216* or listen for warnings on relevant TV and radio broadcasts.
* Calls to 1300 number cost around 27.5c inc. GST, higher from mobiles or public phones. Marine forecasts are also available on VHF and HF radio. View the radio schedule on www.bom.gov.au/marine
Check the latest Coastal Waters Forecast or Local Waters Forecast for information on wind, wave and weather conditions for these coastal zones.

Wind gusts can be 40 percent stronger than the averages given here, and maximum waves may be up to twice the height. Wind warnings are issued for today and tomorrow and describe the highest category of wind warning for that day.

A low over the Tasman Sea will move away to the east today, as a high approaches from the west and extends a ridge over Tasmania. The high centre will slowly pass to the south of the state late on Sunday then move away to the southeast on Monday, directing an easterly flow over Tasmania. The flow will tend more northeasterly on Tuesday as the ridge weakens over Tasmania.

Winds: Southwesterly 10 to 20 knots, reaching 25 knots in the south in the morning, decreasing to 10 to 15 knots in the evening. Seas: 1 to 2 metres, decreasing to 1 to 1.5 metres during the afternoon. Weather: Cloudy. 50% chance of showers.

Winds: Southwesterly 10 to 15 knots tending southerly in the middle of the day then decreasing to below 10 knots in the late evening. Seas: Below 1 metre. Weather: Partly cloudy. 20% chance of a shower.
Winds: Variable about 10 knots. Seas: Below 1 metre. Weather: Partly cloudy. 20% chance of a shower.

Winds: North to northeasterly about 10 knots tending east to northeasterly 15 to 20 knots during the afternoon then becoming north to northeasterly about 10 knots during the evening. Seas: Around 1 metre. Weather: Sunny.
